title: [FR] Make mlflow tracking backend scale beyond thousand of runs

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: priority/important-longterm
labels.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed or may need multiple releases to complete.

body:
## Describe the proposal 
Mlflow tracking backend currently is unable (with any of the currently supported storage backend) to scale in retrieval of runs beyond thousand of runs. My proposal is to consider this as an important issue for mlflow and to prioritize pull requests and issues that goes in this direction.
Here are some ideas : 
* being able to retrieve only some of the metrics, tags, params https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/2212 => improve the backend speed by about x15 but still slow for more than 20000 runs
* using a more efficient storage backend that is adapted to document storage (elastic search, graphql, ...) => that may be a real solution that could truly scale
* I would be glad to hear about other ideas


### Motivation
The use case would be supporting machine learning practitioners that run as teams or alone thousand of runs for a single experiment. Being able to retrieve these runs and compare them is quite important in this case.

### Proposed Changes
The changes would affect the storage backend and possibly the backend API.

The objective of this issue is to hear what you think about this ? is it something you consider important for databricks ? are there lot of users of mlflow that have this use case ?
